question: The "Pueblo Viejo Mine" is located in which country?
explanation: Pueblo Viejo Mine is a gold mine located in the north-central island country of the Dominican Republic in the Hispaniola Islands of the Greater Antilles Archipelago in the West Indies-Caribbean region. This mine is the largest gold mine in the Americas and eighth largest in the world. It is also the first exploited mine by the Spaniards in America.
